title: Louis Tomlinson wears oversized hoodie... as it is revealed One Direction made £2.1million last year
text:
One Direction made £2.1million last year as their company continued to rake in profit despite the band going on indefinite hiatus nearly four years ago.

And Louis Tomlinson was spotted stepping out in a casual ensemble on Saturday as the report of the group's fortune was made public.

The singer, 27, clutched a large Starbucks reusable cup as he took a stroll in the city with friends during a break in between meet and greets.

Fortune: Louis Tomlinson, 27, stepped out in a casual ensemble as he enjoyed an extra large coffee on Saturday as a report claimed One Direction made £2.1million last year

He teamed an oversized cream hoodie with navy Adidas tracksuit bottoms and black trainers for the outing.

He accessorised with a navy baseball cap to hide his signature sweeping hairstyle.

It comes after the value of One Direction's company 1D Media Limited soared from under £5million to more than £7million in 12 months.

And profit went up £1million compared with the previous year, when they made £1.1million, The Sun revealed.

On a break: The singer, 27, clutched a large Starbucks reusable cup as he took a stroll in the city with friends during a break in between meet and greets

But Zayn Malik, 26, will miss out on any bonus as he stopped being a shareholder when he left the band in 2015.

Remaining members Harry Styles, 25, Liam Payne, 26, Niall Horan, 26, and Louis were handed £14million when they stood down as directors three and a half years ago.

But their long running dispute with the taxman will continue, after £24.7million was demanded over a controversial 'alphabet' share scheme, accounts show.

Success: 1D's Liam Payne, 26, Niall Horan, 26, Louis and Harry Styles, 25, were handed £14million when they stood down as directors three years ago (pictured from left to right in December 2015)

It was set up for Zayn to share in profits made before he left to pursue a solo career.

MailOnline has contacted representatives for the boys for comment.

It comes after Louis told Yahoo Entertainment he is now in a 'good place in life' following the tragic deaths of his mother Johannah Deakin and sister Félicité in little over two years.

Comfortable: Louis teamed an oversized cream hoodie with navy Adidas tracksuit bottoms and black trainers for the outing

New music: Louis has just announced his very first tour and the release of his long awaited debut solo album, Walls, for early 2020

Johannah lost her battle with leukaemia in December 2016, aged 43, leaving behind Louis, Félicité and their five siblings.

In March this year, the family was hit by further devastation when Félicité, 18, accidentally died from an overdose of cocaine, an anxiety drug and painkillers.

Discussing the ways in which his grief influenced his songwriting process, Louis said: 'I had a couple of things in my personal life which made momentum a little bit more difficult, naturally.

Disbanded: Zayn Malik (left in 2013), 26, will miss out on any bonus as he stopped being a shareholder when he left the band in 2015

'I touched on [grief] with Two of Us, but I definitely kind of told that story with that, I felt like I needed to get that off my chest creatively in my songwriting because around that time, it was hard for anything to feel more important, obviously, than that.'

The Just Hold On hitmaker continued: 'I feel like I'm in a good place in my life, and naturally with that comes happier songs.

'So I think it all depends on what headspace you're in, really, at the time.'

After tragedy: Louis says he is now in a 'good place in life' following the tragic deaths of his mother and sister in little over two years (pictured with sister Félicité, 18, who died in March from an accidental overdose)
description: Louis Tomlinson, 27, stepped out in a casual ensemble as he enjoyed an extra large coffee to celebrate  on Saturday.
